TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ExpressionsCollectionEditor extends System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a user interface for selecting and editing an expressions binding collection at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor> class is a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> object that can be used at design time to select and edit a collection of expression bindings, and assign the expressions to a control property.
A designer host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], uses the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditor> class implementations with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionConverter> classes to set the expression bindings for control properties at design time, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlPersister> class to persist the expressions for run time. Expression strings reference a localizable resource, an application setting, a connection string, or a custom expression type. The expression string is bound to the control property at design time, and then used at run time to determine the value for the property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object EditValue (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, IServiceProvider provider, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object EditValue(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.IServiceProvider provider, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that can be used to gain additional context information such as the associated control.
A service provider object through which editing services can be obtained.
An instance of the object being edited.
Docs.summary: Edits the value of the specified object with the specified service provider and context.
Docs.returns: An object containing the selected expressions; otherwise, if no expressions are selected, the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method launches the user interface for editing the `value` object. The designer host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method when you attempt to edit the value of a property that this editor is associated with. The input service provider is used to obtain any editing services that are required within the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A>.
A designer host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], uses the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilder> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionEditor> class implementations with the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionConverter> classes to set the expression bindings for control properties at design time, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlPersister> class to persist the expressions for run time. Expression strings reference a localizable resource, an application setting, a connection string, or a custom expression type. The expression string is bound to the control property at design time, and then used at run time to determine the value for the property.
If users cancel the user interface without modifying the expression binding collection, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.EditValue%2A> method returns the input `value` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle GetEditStyle(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that can be used to gain additional context information.
Docs.summary: Gets the editing style that is associated with this editor for the specified context.
Docs.returns: An enumeration value indicating the editing style for the provided user interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> method returns the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle.Modal> value by default.
If <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> is not supported in the specified context, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ExpressionsCollectionEditor.GetEditStyle%2A> returns <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditorEditStyle.None>.
